titleStmt.title: By his Excellency. Whereas it hath pleased God by his gracious providence and goodnesse, to put the city of Edinburgh, and towne of Leith under my power ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)

titleStmt.title: By his Excellency. Whereas it hath pleased God by his gracious providence and goodnesse, to put the city of Edinburgh, and towne of Leith under my power ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)
Cromwell, Oliver, 1599-1658.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Dated at end: Given under my hand at Edinburgh the 7th of September, 1650.
"To be proclaimed at Leith and Edinburgh, by sound of trumpet, and beat of drumme"--colophon.
Imperfect: torn at left margin with some loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
